intro: Thesium dollineri, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces dense clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are typically dark green. Thesium dollineri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils.
